ğŸŒ„ Here's a #Oneplus5T sunrise photo to talk about! @manumanuti tells us about the time he went out at 3am to catch a sunrise in #mexico ğŸ‡²ğŸ‡½ "A couple of friends and I met at 3 am to go to Nevado de Toluca, an active Volcano close to Mexico City famous for its fantastic landscapes. Obviously, when we entered the dirt road, we got lost somewhere along the way, where there was no light or signal - that's how horror movies begin - we all thought at the same time. We arrived just at sunrise and it was extraordinary beautiful. It was our first time up there - how cold it was. At 6:30 AM the sky painted itself with blue, pink, orange -many beautiful colors; the mountains and the absolute nature were covered by a magic light, making it perfect to shoot some photos with portrait mode.Then we began the tortuous climb that was rewarded with an indefinable sight. At the end we rolled downhill to the icy Moon Lagoon, and after some time playing barefoot in the pristine water, we went back to pick up the car and drove back to the city." #ShotonOnePlus

ğŸ‘‘ @manumanuti, king of low-light shares his story behind this amazing photo:
"This year I ran my fifth marathon in #Toronto #Canada and the day of the race, after a deserved nap, I decided to take a night walk. Since I started taking pictures, I have always been fascinated by reflections, so I decided to try it, taking advantage of the recent rain. It was not easy because of the cars that passed continuously, one of them totally bathed me with an urban tsunami, but I didn't care. For better shots of reflexes, I usually bend down as much as I can and turn the cell phone 180Âº so that the camera is as close as possible to the water. Then I took a bus and headed to the nice Distillery District, famous for its restaurants and craft breweries that turn on their bright neons to attract people. The #OnePlus5T automatic camera adapts very well to these strong contrasts of night light, and allows to adjust the lighting when focusing the object with the tip of the finger. Many of the times, a tripod is not even necessary for shots like these. "

ğŸ—»ğŸ’– #OnePlus5T user @manumanuti shares his story behind this breathtaking photo from #Argentina:
"Ushuaia, Argentina is the southernmost city on the planet and itâ€™s said to be the gateway to the end of the world. During my stay I visited several photogenic places, including the one in this image. It was a wooden lodge with a hatchery of beautiful Huskies that are used during the winter to pull sledges. In front of it there was this small lake that reflected the Andes on the horizon. Great natural landscapes with a tiny human presence that increase the effect of immensity and majesty. The photo was taken in Pro Mode, which allowed me to adjust the ISO, and speed. For photos like this the ideal is also to use the grid and play with the symmetry, placing the subject right in the middle. After this place, we continued with the tour to Hidden Lake and Fagnano Lake."

"This pic was taken spontaneously in Switzerland, at the moment of the sunset above the Leman lake. I was inline skating near the port, which is my favorite spot since I was kid. When I saw this public boat approaching, I moved very fast towards the embarkment to take picture of it. This photo works mostly thanks to the light, but the design of the boat, which is one of the oldest boats on the lake, as well as the Alps behind are also very strong elements here."

Wonder how one of our favorite #OnePlus5 users @javin_lau shot this incredible photo at #brooklynpier? ğŸ˜± Read below!ğŸ‘‡ ---
"Twilight from Brooklyn. This photo was shot in Manual Mode because I wanted to expose the photo for 3-5 seconds to ensure that the water would appear to be flowing in the photo, as well as ensure that I could lower my ISO to reduce the noise. RAW capture was also a key consideration as well, to ensure a higher dynamic range for post processing. This photo was edited in Lightroom with both shadow and highlight adjustments, and toning to get the colours just right."
---

Hi everyone, this is @sagesolar from the UK, taking over @oneplustech for the weekend to share some of my photos with you.

I hope you are all enjoying #WorldPhotographyDay!

I captured this sunset with the #OnePlus3 on a warm summer evening at #Chichester Harbour.

Camera settings: f/2 | 1/250sec | ISO-100

Hello everyone, it's @sagesolar here, sharing some of my photos with you. I hope everyone is enjoying their weekend so far. 
I took this photo with the #OnePlus3 at one of my favourite weekend destinations, Uppark House in #WestSussex. 
Camera settings: f/2 | 1/1600sec | ISO-100

Hello everyone, it's @sagesolar again. I hope everyone has had a great day!

I took this photo with the #OnePlus3 on a seaside pier near where I live in #BognorRegis. I really like how the detail in the boardwalk was captured. The camera is great for #blackAndWhite photos too. 
Edited in Pixlr to convert to black and white.

Camera settings: f/2 | 1/30sec | ISO-100

Hey everyone @sagesolar here, sharing some more of my photos with you. I hope you're all having a great weekend. 
I took this photo of a partly cloudy and starry night sky with a tripod mounted #OnePlus3. I was on the #SouthDowns hills in West Sussex, about two hours after sunset. I was really impressed with how well the camera was able to capture the stars and the detail of the tower so late at night using a long exposure.

If anyone would like to know more about #astrophotography or the editing process, please leave a comment or message my @sagesolar account, and I'll get in touch. 
Edited in Lightroom to reduce pixel noise and to enhance the details.

Camera settings: f/2 | 30sec | ISO-3200

Hey everyone @sagesolar here, this is the last photo I would like to share this weekend. I hope you all enjoy your week ahead, and thank you for all your likes and comments.

I took this star trail photo on a clear summer night with a tripod mounted #OnePlus3 pointing at the Pole Star. I was on the #SouthDowns hills in West Sussex, about four hours after sunset. This photo is a composite of 70 individual exposures, which I later combined in star trail software to achieve the circular trails.

If anyone would like to know more about #astrophotography, #startrails or the editing process, please leave a comment or message my @sagesolar account, and I'll get in touch. 
Edited in Startrails.de to combine the original exposures, and in Lightroom to reduce pixel noise and to enhance the details.

Camera settings: f/2 | 35min (70 x 30sec) | ISO-2000
